title: How has public transportation improved in your country?

korean: 제가 어렸을 때랑 비교하면 정말 많이 좋아졌어요.
예전에는 버스 언제 오는지 정확히 알 수가 없었거든요.
지금은 스마트폰으로 실시간 위치 다 확인할 수 있잖아요.
신분당선, 신림선 같은 새로운 노선들이 계속 생기고 있어요.
환승 통로가 잘 연결돼 있어서 시간도 많이 줄었고.
교통 약자를 위한 시설도 많이 개선됐어요.
엘리베이터나 휠체어 리프트 같은 게 대부분 역에 있고.
저상버스도 많아져서 유모차 타고 다니기 편해졌죠.
앞으로는 자율주행 버스 같은 것도 도입된다고 하니까 기대돼요.
english: Compared to when I was young, it's gotten so much better.
In the past, you couldn't know exactly when the bus would come.
You'd just wait endlessly at the bus stop.
Now you can check the real-time location on your smartphone, right?
New lines like Shinbundang Line and Sillim Line keep being created.
Transfers have become much more convenient too.
The transfer corridors are well-connected, so it saves a lot of time.
Facilities for the transportation disadvantaged have improved a lot too.
Most stations have elevators and wheelchair lifts.
There are more low-floor buses too, so it's easier to get around with strollers.
I'm looking forward to the future because they say autonomous buses will be introduced.
